text:
The Kupu editor isn't following the proper rules as far as when you can edit a
document or what state and edited document will go in. If the document is in a
review state, the Kupu editor will allow it to be edited. If the document is in
a live state, saving from Kupu will not move it to authoring. I think this is
due to the fact there is no xconf file for Kupu. It was removed in svn commit
r492470. Bitflux and FCKeditor both work.

that commit was mine, but the patch came from jonathan iirc.
i think the reason for the removal of the xconf was that kupu does not yet use
the usecase framework, hence no need to register a usecase. 
or maybe i made a mistake when preparing the patch for commit...

jonathan, can you clarify?
